snippet: The former employee, who was facilities director of the memorial, contends that he was dismissed for raising health and security concerns about the Lower Manhattan site.
abstract: Thomas Cancelliere, former manager at the National September 11 Memorial and Museum in Manhattan, claims in a lawsuit that he was fired for raising health and security concerns at one of the most security-conscious locations in the world; suit seeks unspecified damages under New York State's whistle-blower protection law.
lead_paragraph: The former employee, who was facilities director of the memorial, contends that he was dismissed for raising health and security concerns about the Lower Manhattan site.

headline.seo: Manager of 9/11 Memorial Sues Over His Firing
